author: potuz
content:
> I think its fine for the relay to handle KZG inclusion proof computation, proposer doesn't need to also do it
<@539495253418180618> <@363800010518822915> one extra difficulty here is that the proposer will have to compute some inclusion proof (probably empty) for its local block as well.

author: jgm
content: Will the locally built block not include blob transactions from the public mempool?

author: jgm
content: Sorry, trying to understand why the inclusion proof would be empty for a locally-produced block.

author: potuz
content: "Probably", I was just pointing that this is new behavior: clients currently prepare one object and only one, a consensus block. And then request either a payload from the EL or a hash from the relay. The point is that the one block works for both. With this change now CL clients need to prepare two different things, the block and compute different proofs to include in sidecars. The probably meant that the local block may not include any blob txs

author: jgm
content: I followed this up to the last sentence. Are you suggesting that local blocks (possibly) without blobs would be the normal situation post fork, or that it is likely to be a short term thing due to the change, until CLs are updated to obtain blobs and generate the sidecars themselves?

author: potuz
content: I'm not suggesting anything. you can forget about the possibility of the empty proofs if you want from that sentence.
